newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia's biggest bank posts record profits.
newsitem.headline: Australia's biggest bank posts record profits.

text.p: Australia's largest bank, National Australia Bank Ltd (NAB), reported a record annual net profit of A$2.10 billion (US$1.66 billion) on Thursday and predicted further improvement.
Net profit for the year to September 30, 1996 rose 6.8 percent from A$1.97 billion, while operating profit increased to A$3.06 billion from A$2.85 billion previously.
Managing director Don Argus said he was confident the group's performance would improve in spite of strong competition in all markets and subdued economic activity.
"We are focussed on the fundamentals of our business," Argus said in a statement. "We also have a vast potential market through our international spread of business units."
NAB said its Australian banking operations reported a slightly lower profit for the year, but operations in the United States, New Zealand and Britain made strong profit contributions.
It also announced plans to buy back about 13 million of its ordinary shares, representing 0.9 percent of the bank's issued capital, at an estimated cost of A$181 million.
Directors declared a final dividend of A$0.44 for a total dividend of A$0.87 against A$0.83 last year. NAB shares rose to an all-time high of A$14.12 on the news.
